trans-unit.source: Service Management Versioning
trans-unit.target: Service Management Versioning

trans-unit.source: Operations provided by the Service Management API may have multiple versions.
trans-unit.target: Operations provided by the Service Management API may have multiple versions.

trans-unit.source: You must specify the version of an operation that you want to use by setting the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> request header.
trans-unit.target: You must specify the version of an operation that you want to use by setting the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> request header.

trans-unit.source: Requests without an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header will be rejected and return a <legacyBold>(400) Bad Request response</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Requests without an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header will be rejected and return a <legacyBold>(400) Bad Request response</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: If your service calls an older version of an operation, you can choose to continue calling the older version, or modify your code to call a newer version.
trans-unit.target: If your service calls an older version of an operation, you can choose to continue calling the older version, or modify your code to call a newer version.

trans-unit.source: Any differences in functionality between versions are outlined in the documentation for the API call.
trans-unit.target: Any differences in functionality between versions are outlined in the documentation for the API call.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> request header value must be specified in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> request header value must be specified in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
